'Jewish holidays,' also known as 'Jewish festivals,' observed by Jews This
article focuses on practices of mainstream Rabbinic Judaism. Karaite Jews and
Samaritans observe the biblical festivals, but not identically, and not always
exactly on the same day. throughout the year, have three principal
sources: Biblical mitzvot (commandments), rabbinical mandate, and modern
Israeli history.
